alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 10:52AM CDT until May 18 at 8:12AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Caldwell, Fayette, Gonzales, Guadalupe, Lee and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seguin, Lockhart, Bastrop, Gonzales, Luling, Giddings, La Grange, Smithville, Schulenburg, Stockdale, Flatonia, Lexington, Kosciusko, McQueeney, Nixon, Martindale, Waelder, Mustang Ridge, Kingsbury and Niederwald. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
